summary: On December 20, 2025, the US Justice Department released a large but incomplete set of documents related to investigations into late financier and convicted sex offender Jeffrey Epstein. The release, mandated by a new federal law, included heavily redacted files and photos of high-profile individuals such as Bill Clinton, Donald Trump, Andrew Mountbatten-Windsor, and Michael Jackson. Hundreds of thousands of documents remain sealed.

title: Anthony Joshua knocks out Jake Paul in sixth round boxing match
snippets: Former ‍heavyweight ‍champion beats ⁠social media star turned fighter ‍with a sixth-round knockout in Miami.
British heavyweight Anthony Joshua needs six rounds to stop boxing novice Jake Paul, who spends much of the contest in survival mode.
Anthony Joshua stopped Jake Paul in the sixth round of their heavyweight fight on Friday.
Anthony Joshua knocks out Jake Paul in sixth round of heavyweight bout The Globe and Mail

MIAMI — Anthony Joshua knocked out Jake Paul in the sixth round of their heavyweight fight on Friday night. The two-time heavyweight champion displayed why he is one of the sport’s elite punchers when he dropped the fading Paul twice in the fifth round. Sensing the YouTuber was finished, Joshua rocked him with a right uppercut early in the sixth. The native of England then floored Paul with a combination to the head. Although Paul (12-2) reached his feet again, Joshua (29-4, 26 KOs) finally crushed Paul’s upset dream when he dropped him a fourth time with a right to the head. Referee...

summary: Former heavyweight champion Anthony Joshua defeated Jake Paul by knockout in the sixth round of their heavyweight boxing match in Miami on Friday. Joshua dropped Paul multiple times, including twice in the fifth round, before ending the fight with a right hand in the sixth. Paul, a social media personality turned boxer, was unable to recover, giving Joshua the win.

title: Seattle Kraken trade Mason Marchment to Columbus Blue Jackets
snippets: The Seattle Kraken have traded forward Mason Marchment to the Columbus Blue Jackets for two draft picks.
Marchment traded to Blue Jackets by Kraken NHL.com

The Columbus Blue Jackets added veteran size and toughness to their roster by acquiring forward Mason Marchment from the Seattle Kraken in a move completed on Friday night just before the NHL’s holiday roster freeze. The Kraken received a 2027 second-round draft pick and a fourth-round pick in next year’s draft, which the Blue Jackets previously acquired in a trade with the New York Rangers. The 30-year-old Marchment provides a physical presence in being listed at six-foot-five and 215 pounds.
